## Content overview

This week, we will focus on the basics of the Unix shell, and you will learn:

#### [**Unix shell basics**](w2_01_shell.qmd) (Tuesday)

- What the Unix shell is and what you can do with it
- Why it can be beneficial to use a command-line interface in general and the shell specifically
- What the Unix file structure looks like and what paths are
- How Unix commands are stuctured
- How to navigate around your computer with Unix commands

<hr style="height:1pt; visibility:hidden;" />

#### [**Unix shell: working with files**](w2_02_shell.qmd) (Thursday)

Using Unix commands, how to:

- Create, copy, move, rename and delete directories and files
- View text files in various ways
- Search within, manipulate, and extract information from text files
